alert.note: Alert for Jack (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 11 at 7:03PM CDT until further notice by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL JACK COUNTY... At 702 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Jacksboro, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Jack County, moving along or south of Highway 59, including the following locations... Lost Creek Reservoir. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter now! Get to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building and avoid windows.
